page_title: 9 Days Skardu Pakistan Tour Package from Islamabad

sections.content: Skardu Valley is famous for its scenic lakes (Kachura & Satpara), the Deosai National Park (the ‘Highest Plain’), Shigar River, Ambrique Mosque, Hashupi Bagh and stunning views of Nanga Parbat. Temperatures can drop as low as –20 °C in winter, so we recommend this comfortable road-trip package to explore Baltistan’s highlights safely.

content: Marvel at Deosai National Park – Highest Plain
Visit Shigar River, Ambrique Mosque & Hashupi Bagh
Breathtaking views from Nanga Parbat View Point
Sheosar Lake, Kala Pani & Shatong Rivers and wildlife

Day_1: Departure from Lahore to Chilas at 22:00 via private transport
Overnight road travel via Motorway & Expressway
Day_2: Pick up in Islamabad, drive to Chilas via Hazara Expressway
Breakfast break at Balakot or Besham
Visit Babusar Top and Lulusar Lake en route
Day_3: Drive Chilas → Skardu via Gilgit–Skardu Road (5–6 hrs)
Day_4: Jeep excursion to Deosai Plain (4 113 m)
Sightseeing at Kala Pani & Bara Pani
Day_5: Breakfast, visit Katpana Cold Desert sand dunes
Day_6: Drive back to Naran/Besham via Skardu–Gilgit–Jaglot
Stops at Lulusar Lake & Babusar Top
Day_7: Drive Naran/Besham → Lahore/Islamabad via Hazara Motorway
Stops at Kiwayi Waterfall, Balakot, Batgram
Arrive by evening; end of journey

content.question: How to book the Skardu tour?
content.answer: Pay 30–50 % advance by bank transfer, JazzCash/EasyPaisa, Wise, Western Union or similar; balance due on departure.

content.question: Is Skardu safe for tourists?
content.answer: Yes—Skardu is a secure destination for families and couples, with stable conditions year-round.

content.question: Are there direct flights to Skardu?
content.answer: From Islamabad: 2 flights/week (Nov–Apr), daily (May–Sep); from Lahore & Karachi: 2 flights/week (May–Sep).

content.question: What is special about Skardu?
content.answer: Gateway to peaks like Gasherbrum, K2, Deosai Plain; renowned hospitality and Baltistan culture.

content.question: Is there an airport in Skardu?
content.answer: Yes. Skardu Airport in Gamba is 19 km from city center.

content.question: Which mobile networks work in Skardu?
content.answer: All major operators, with Telenor, SCOM & Zong most reliable.

content.question: What are Jeep rates for Deosai & Basho?
content.answer: Prado (5–6 pax): Rs 15 000–17 000 round-trip to Deosai or Basho.

content.question: What are the best restaurants in Skardu?
content.answer: Indus Lodges, Shahi Deewan, Khan Shinwari, North Café, The Grind Café.

content.question: What to buy in Skardu?
content.answer: Pashmina shawls, carpets, Balti jewelry, dried fruits, Shilajit.

content.question: Which mountain range is Skardu in?
content.answer: Skardu sits in Baltistan, part of the western Himalayas.

content.question: How far is Hunza from Skardu?
content.answer: Approximately 290 km (5 hrs) via KKH & Gilgit–Skardu Road.

content.question: Can you see K2 from Skardu?
content.answer: Not from town—you need a 2–3 day trek to view K2.

content.question: What are the best hotels to stay in Skardu?
content.answer: Khoj Resort, Himalaya Hotel, Himmel Resort, Shangrila Resort, Qayam Skardu, Al-Noor Starlet.

content.question: Which transport is used?
content.answer: AC Coaster/Saloon or coach based on group size; vehicles serviced and sanitized.

content.question: What are the terms & conditions?
content.answer: Check-in 12 pm/check-out 10 am; specified meals only; ID required; rates vary on blackout dates; itinerary subject to change.

content: Accommodation in hotel as per the variant selected
Breakfast and dinner as mentioned in the variant
All toll tax, parking, fuel & driver allowances
Comfortable and sanitized vehicle on all days
Lunch, tea & mineral water during travel
Laundry, beverages, phone calls & personal expenses
Extra expenses due to acts of nature or political reasons
Porter for personal luggage, medication, evacuation & rescue

chunks.text: Skardu Valley is famous for its scenic lakes (Kachura & Satpara), the Deosai National Park (the ‘Highest Plain’), Shigar River, Ambrique Mosque, Hashupi Bagh and stunning views of Nanga Parbat. Temperatures can drop as low as –20 °C in winter, so we recommend this comfortable road-trip package to explore Baltistan’s highlights safely.
Lahore – Karachi – Islamabad

Scenic drive via Naran/Besham & Chilas Experience Kachura & Satpara Lakes Marvel at Deosai National Park – Highest Plain Visit Shigar River, Ambrique Mosque & Hashupi Bagh Breathtaking views from Nanga Parbat View Point Explore Shigar Fort Jeep ride to Sadpara Lake Shangrila Lake & Upper Kachura Lake Basho Valley green pastures Sheosar Lake, Kala Pani & Shatong Rivers and wildlife
Departure from Lahore to Chilas at 22:00 via private transport Overnight road travel via Motorway & Expressway
Pick up in Islamabad, drive to Chilas via Hazara Expressway Breakfast break at Balakot or Besham Visit Babusar Top and Lulusar Lake en route Overnight stay in Chilas
Drive Chilas → Skardu via Gilgit–Skardu Road (5–6 hrs) Visit Upper Kachura & Shangrila Lakes Explore Soq Valley Overnight stay in Skardu
Jeep excursion to Deosai Plain (4 113 m) Short stay at Sheosar Lake Sightseeing at Kala Pani & Bara Pani Return to Skardu, overnight stay
Breakfast, visit Katpana Cold Desert sand dunes Paramotor, jeep safari, four-wheeler rides Explore Shigar Valley & Shigar Fort Overnight stay in Skardu
Drive back to Naran/Besham via Skardu–Gilgit–Jaglot Stops at Lulusar Lake & Babusar Top Overnight stay in Naran/Besham
Drive Naran/Besham → Lahore/Islamabad via Hazara Motorway Stops at Kiwayi Waterfall, Balakot, Batgram Arrive by evening; end of journey
